Allele.description: One of multiple possible forms of a functional genomic element (most often described as a locus or gene), differing from the reference DNA sequence.  The genomic element can be endogenous or constructed.

associated_notes.description: Notes associated with the entity in some way

associated_references.description: References associated with the entity in some way

created_by.description: The individual that created the entity.

creation_date.description: The date on which an entity was created. This can be applied to nodes or edges.

cross_references.description: Holds between an object and its CrossReferences.

curie.description: A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI

date_last_modified.description: Date on which an entity was last modified.

embryonic_stem_cell_lines.description: Embryonic stem cell lines known to carry the allele

functional_impact.description: Experimentally assessed functional impact of the allele, e.g. knockout / amorphic

generation_method.description: Technique used to create the allele, e.g. spontaneous / naturally occuring / radiation

in_collection.description: Set of high-throughput alleles made by large projects

inheritence_mode.description: Mode of inheritence, e.g. dominant / semi-dominant / recessive / unknown

is_extinct.description: Does the allele still exist in a population somewhere?

modified_by.description: The individual that last modified the entity.

molecular_mutation.description: Description of the DNA changes if precise genomic location unknown

name.description: a human-readable name for an entity

origins.description: Affected genomic models that the allele was introduced in

synonyms.description: synonyms for allele names and synonyms

table_key.description: The primary key for a specific table entry, unique for that table.

Allele.title: Allele
